info.document:
Sept 15 (Reuters) - Jose regained hurricane strength in the
Atlantic Ocean on Friday and might possibly threaten New York
and New England, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
Jose was a Category 1 hurricane, the weakest level on the
Saffir-Simpson wind scale, with maximum sustained winds of 75
miles per hour (120 kph), the Miami-based center said.
Forecast tracks showed the storm, now about 485 miles (785
km) southwest of Bermuda, heading up off the East Coast and
possibly glancing New York, New England or Canada's maritime
provinces.
(Reporting by Swati Verma in Bengaluru; Editing by Sandra
Maler)
